channel.title: Compiler
channel.description:
This is my compile code
[code]@echo off title Building Files "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -d ./sign/*.java pause[/code]
And I have all of my java and class files together because its a webclient and have both signlink files in a file called sign and this is the error i get.
[code]javac: not a directory: ./sign/signlink.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Change the value for -d to the directory you want the class files to be put, and including all of the files in the default package might help.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

so what should i change it to

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:1, topic:430627”]This is my compile code

@echo off title Building Files "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -d ./sign/*.java pause

And I have all of my java and class files together because its a webclient and have both signlink files in a file called sign and this is the error i get.

javac: not a directory: ./sign/signlink.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

You’re setting the output directory for the class files to sign/signlink.java, which isn’t a directory.

Read full topic
